Detailed Description

This class caches data from recent searches.

It is purposefully not defined in the header file so that our users need not know its contents.

Member Function Documentation

void NavigatorCache::clearWayPath (  )  [inline]

Clear the waypoint path.

void NavigatorCache::clearWaySetPath (  )  [inline]

Clears the waypoint set path.

This may be necessary because different results will be obtained depending on whether ChunkWPSetState::blockNonPermissive is true or false.

bool NavigatorCache::findWayPath ( const ChunkWaypointState &  src,
const ChunkWaypointState &  dst 
)

This method indicates whether the cached path matches up with the next iteration's source point and the presumed destination.

This is typically called when the entity has moved towards the path.

Parameters:
src The source waypoint search state.
dst The destination waypoint search state.
Returns:
The next waypoint search state stored in the cache, or NULL if the destination changed or we have run out of intermediate nodes.

bool NavigatorCache::findWaySetPath ( const ChunkWPSetState &  src,
const ChunkWPSetState &  dst 
)

This method finds a waypoint set path that is stored in the cache.

Parameters:
src The source waypoint set search state.
dst The destination waypoint set search state.
Returns:
The intermediate waypoint set search state.

int NavigatorCache::getWaySetPathSize (  )  const

This method finds a waypoint path.

const ChunkWPSetState* NavigatorCache::pNextWaypointSetState (  )  const [inline]

Return the next waypoint set state in the path.

const ChunkWaypointState* NavigatorCache::pNextWaypointState (  )  const [inline]

Get the location of the next waypoint in the stored waypoint path.

void NavigatorCache::saveWayPath ( AStar< ChunkWaypointState > &  astar  ) 

This method saves a waypoint path.

Both the source and destination (goal) are extracted from the search result in the given AStar object. (i.e. must be unspoilt)

void NavigatorCache::saveWaySetPath ( AStar< ChunkWPSetState > &  astar  ) 

This method saves a waypoint set path.

Both the source and destination (goal) are extracted from the search result in the given AStar object. (i.e. must be unspoilt)
